instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 15 (820-2915) Keyboard issue
threads.message: Hi the middle row of keyboard not working letters (asdfghjkl) try new keyboard same ,was some kind of damage where is pin 30 ,but fixed and everything looks ok ,I mean all pins are soldered ok and no damaged

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 15 (820-2915) Keyboard issue
threads.message:
The entire row not working suggests a bad PSOC/Keyboard controller.
They can be awkward to replaced though due to size. Make sure you replace it with one from the correct board as they are programmed.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 15 (820-2915) Keyboard issue
threads.message: Keyboard connector or trace. Test all pins of the connector on diode mode. A bad U5701 is very rare.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 15 (820-2915) Keyboard issue
threads.message: Replace new U5701 same ,new keyboard connector same ?????

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 15 (820-2915) Keyboard issue
threads.message: Do you have maybe clear me bios for this one ,maybe its something fucked in bios ,820-2915-a

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 15 (820-2915) Keyboard issue
threads.message: You can replace the chip and connector, but the first thing you should have checked was a corroded trace.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 15 (820-2915) Keyboard issue
threads.message: Already replaced chip and connector all pins  are ok

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 15 (820-2915) Keyboard issue
threads.message: What is between the connector and the chip?.....traces maybe? Diode mode all pins on the connector and one will be wrong.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Pro 15 (820-2915) Keyboard issue
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 26491"]What is between the connector and the chip?.....traces maybe? Diode mode all pins on the connector and one will be wrong.[/QUOTE]

THX solved one of the traces was damaged now works all letters ,thx again
